FuncDef:
The channel-port command adds an interface on a chassis to a virtual cluster data channel group.
The undo channel-port command deletes an interface from a virtual cluster data channel group.
By default, no interface on a chassis is added to a virtual cluster data channel group.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an interface.
The value is a string of 1 to 50 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the type and number of an interface.
The value can be: 1 , 8 , 10 , 11 , 12 , 14 , 15 , 16 , 17 , 18 , 19, 1025.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When deploying virtual cluster, you must create an inter-chassis data channel group for data communication in virtual cluster mode. To add an interface on a chassis to a virtual cluster data channel group, run the channel-port command.
Prerequisites
A virtual cluster data channel group has been created.
Precautions
The channel-port command applies only to a 10GE or higher-speed interface with no configuration available.The channel-port command does not take effect on a CR5D0L5XFA7L/CR5DL2XEIG7L/CR5D0EMGFA7L/CR5D0EFGFA73/CR5DL1XEDG70/CX6D0EMGFA1B/CR5DL4XEBG7L.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
